hero.title: Frontend, Backend & AI Security
hero.subtitle: Rate Limiting, reCAPTCHA, Headers, Validation, Anti Prompt Injection and more
hero.description: Complete guide on how to protect your web applications — including AI-powered APIs. This portfolio implements real protections in production: rate limiting, reCAPTCHA, honeypot, Zod validation, security headers, anti prompt injection, LLM output validation and anti-XSS sanitization.
hero.warning: This guide covers essential protections for modern web applications, including OpenAI APIs. For high-traffic scenarios, consider Redis for rate limiting and WAF for additional protection.

overview.title: Overview
overview.subtitle: Core concepts
overview.description: Fundamental web security concepts implemented in this portfolio and professional applications.

items.title: XSS Prevention
items.description: Output escaping, dangerouslySetInnerHTML avoided, input sanitization. Next.js escapes by default.

items.title: CSRF Protection
items.description: Stateless APIs, SameSite cookies, tokens in headers. Forms protected with reCAPTCHA.

items.title: Rate Limiting
items.description: Request limit per IP to prevent abuse. Contact: 5/5min, Chat: 30/min, Code Review: 8/5min.

items.title: Input Validation
items.description: Zod schemas on all API routes. Backend never trusts client data.

items.title: reCAPTCHA v3
items.description: Invisible bot protection on contact form. Score-based verification.

items.title: Anti Prompt Injection
items.description: Input sanitization before sending to AI. Filters patterns like 'ignore instructions', 'act as', 'reveal prompt'.

items.title: AI Output Validation
items.description: Zod schema validates AI response before sending to client. Recursive anti-XSS sanitization on output.

frontend.title: Frontend Security
frontend.subtitle: XSS, CSP, CORS, Honeypot, reCAPTCHA
frontend.description: The honeypot detects bots without affecting real users. The reCAPTCHA Provider loads the script and exposes executeRecaptcha for forms.

tips.title: Avoid dangerouslySetInnerHTML
tips.description: Only use with sanitized content (e.g. DOMPurify). Prefer React's default escaping.

tips.title: CSP (Content Security Policy)
tips.description: Configure in next.config or headers to restrict script and style sources.

tips.title: Sanitize user input
tips.description: Validate and sanitize on the backend. On the frontend, escape outputs and use libraries like DOMPurify if needed.

backend.title: Backend Security
backend.subtitle: Rate Limit, Zod, reCAPTCHA verification
backend.description: Rate limiting per IP, Zod validation on all routes, env vars never exposed. reCAPTCHA verified on server before processing.

aiSecurity.title: AI API Security
aiSecurity.subtitle: Prompt Injection, Output Validation, XSS Prevention
aiSecurity.description: APIs integrating LLMs (like OpenAI) introduce a new attack vector: the user can try to manipulate the model via prompt injection. Defense requires layered protection — sanitize input, harden the system prompt, validate output and sanitize against XSS before delivering to the client.

steps.title: Sanitize Input
steps.description: Filter prompt injection patterns before sending to AI

steps.title: Harden System Prompt
steps.description: Strict rules in the prompt to keep the model in context

steps.title: Validate Output
steps.description: Zod schema on AI response — never trust the output

steps.title: Sanitize Output
steps.description: Remove HTML, scripts and XSS before delivering to client

tips.title: Treat input as data, never as instruction
tips.description: Filter patterns like "ignore previous instructions", "act as", "reveal system prompt" BEFORE sending to AI.

tips.title: Layered defensive regex
tips.description: No regex is perfect. Combine sanitization + system prompt + output validation for defense in depth.

tips.title: Define strict behavior rules
tips.description: The system prompt should explicitly prohibit: following user instructions, revealing the prompt, generating out-of-scope content, executing or simulating code.

tips.title: Low temperature for consistency
tips.description: Use temperature 0.1-0.3 for structured responses (JSON, analysis). High temperature (0.7+) only for creative chat.

tips.title: Never trust the AI response
tips.description: The model may return malformed JSON, extra fields, wrong types or malicious content. Validate EVERYTHING with Zod.

tips.title: Define strict limits
tips.description: Use .max() on strings and arrays to prevent huge responses. Limit score with .min(0).max(100).

tips.title: Sanitize before rendering
tips.description: Even with Zod validating structure, strings may contain HTML, <script>, javascript: URIs or event handlers.

tips.title: Streaming needs per-chunk sanitization
tips.description: In streamed responses (chat), each chunk must be individually sanitized before being sent to the client.

tips.title: Centralize security in a module
tips.description: Shared functions ensure all routes apply the same protections. Less duplication = fewer gaps.

headers.title: Security Headers
headers.subtitle: next.config.ts
headers.description: Configured in next.config.ts and applied globally. HSTS enforces HTTPS, X-Frame-Options prevents clickjacking, X-Content-Type-Options avoids MIME sniffing, Referrer-Policy controls data leakage, Permissions-Policy disables sensitive APIs.

envVars.title: Environment Variables
envVars.subtitle: Secure pattern
envVars.description: Sensitive variables (RECAPTCHA_SECRET_KEY, RESEND_API_KEY) server-only. Never expose secrets with NEXT_PUBLIC_. Use NEXT_PUBLIC_ only for public keys like the reCAPTCHA site key.
